column1: The atoms of a chemical element can exist in different types. These are called isotopes. They have the same number of protons (and electrons)
column2: but different numbers of neutrons. Different isotopes of the same element have different masses. Mass is the word for how much substance (or matter) something has. Things with different masses have different weights. Because different isotopes have different numbers of neutrons
column3: they do not all weigh the same or have the same mass.Different isotopes of the same element have the same atomic number. They have the same number of protons. The atomic number is decided by the number of protons. Isotopes have different mass numbers
column5: because they have different numbers of neutrons.The word isotope
column7: comes from the fact that isotopes are at the same place on the periodic table.
